item.title: Cone-Surface Projections
item.description:
One of the first properties encountered in Compton camera image reconstruction is the cone-surface projection. Understandig the properties of this geometrical object will set the ground works for understanding more advanced models.

I was reading some articles of the early versions of the Compton camera image reconstruction procedure when I came across Ref.[1] talking about the cone-surface projections. They investigated a primitive version of a ‘‘Compton camera’’. Well, it kind of had some properties like a Compton camera like a scatterer and an absorber but they assumed that photons only scatter at a fixed given angle. This camera measures the cone-surface projection of a source.
